issue.title: Inconsistent assignability of enum literal unions vs enum
issue.body:
**Bug Report**

Enum should be assignable to union of its literals (expansion). Mypy usually understands that, but not when union is behind an alias.

**To Reproduce**

[playground](https://mypy-play.net/?mypy=master&python=3.12&flags=strict&gist=4a1a19c716649defc7832b9fa1a03bdf)


```python
from enum import Enum
from typing import Literal

class E(Enum):
    A = 'a'
    B = 'b'
    C = 'c'
    
A = Literal[E.A]
B = Literal[E.B, E.C]

def f(x: A | B) -> None: ...
def f2(x: A | Literal[E.B, E.C]) -> None: ...
def f3(x: Literal[E.A] | B) -> None: ...

def main(x: E) -> None:
    f(x)  # E: Argument 1 to "f" has incompatible type "E"; expected "Literal[E.A] | Literal[E.B, E.C]"  [arg-type]
    f2(x)
    f3(x)  # E: Argument 1 to "f" has incompatible type "E"; expected "Literal[E.A] | Literal[E.B, E.C]"  [arg-type]
```

**Expected Behavior**

Success, 0 errors.

**Actual Behavior**

```
main.py:17: error: Argument 1 to "f" has incompatible type "E"; expected "Literal[E.A] | Literal[E.B, E.C]"  [arg-type]
main.py:19: error: Argument 1 to "f3" has incompatible type "E"; expected "Literal[E.A] | Literal[E.B, E.C]"  [arg-type]
Found 2 errors in 1 file (checked 1 source file)
```

**Your Environment**

<!-- Include as many relevant details about the environment you experienced the bug in -->

- Mypy version used: 1.15.0 and master
- Mypy command-line flags: n/a
- Mypy configuration options from `mypy.ini` (and other config files): n/a
- Python version used: 3.12

I have a patch for this - just a small impl omission. Discovered while looking at #18895.

issue.title: Exclude irrelevant members in `narrow_declared_type` from union overlapping with enum

body:
Hmm, I notice that if both typeguards use literals (instead of one using a union of literals), then we don't even put a union of `TypeGuardType`s in the binder.  [This branch](https://github.com/python/mypy/blob/749f2584da9425173d68eb220db7e92aa13ad8ea/mypy/typeops.py#L625-L629) in `make_simplified_union` flattens them into non-`TypeGuardType`-wrapped literals/unions (though I'm not sure that's intentional), which avoids this crash.

Is having a union-of-`TypeGuardType`s in the binder useful / meaningful? Or would it make sense to flatten that to a `TypeGuardType`-of-a-union or just a plain union before putting it in the binder?

issue.title: TypeGuardedType runtime error in mypy when linting

labels.name: wait for upstream
labels.description: Wait for an upstream update before continuing

issue.body:
```
$ poetry run mypy --show-traceback .
./atr/db/__init__.py: error: INTERNAL ERROR -- Please try using mypy master on GitHub:
https://mypy.readthedocs.io/en/stable/common_issues.html#using-a-development-mypy-build
Please report a bug at https://github.com/python/mypy/issues
version: 1.16.0
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/sbp/ASF/tooling-trusted-release/.venv/bin/mypy", line 8, in <module>
    sys.exit(console_entry())
  File "mypy/build.py", line 2062, in wrap_context
RuntimeError: ('Not implemented', <class 'mypy.types.TypeGuardedType'>)
./atr/db/__init__.py: : note: use --pdb to drop into pdb
```

Presumably related to python/mypy#18895, which was closed on 11 Apr 2025. Version 1.16.0 of mypy was released on 29 May 2025, so it should incorporate this fix, but we obtain this error.

issue.title: Prevent TypeGuardedType leak from `narrow_declared_type` as part of typevar bound
issue.body: Fixes #20015, refs #18895 as a previous example of the same issue. I don't see any similar problems in other branches.
